properties.entry: The change-add command adds a change to the currently open release. The command will fail if the release is not open for modification. Releases are opened for modification with the release-begin command, and closed for modification with the release-finish command.
The initialize command initializes an empty changelog.
The write-plain command produces a humanly-readable plain text version of the changelog. Various options can be specified to control which entries are displayed, and how they are formatted.
The write-xhtml command produces an XHTML version of the changelog. Various options can be specified to control which entries are displayed, and how they are formatted.
The write-atom command produces an Atom RSS feed of the changelog. Various options can be specified to control which entries are displayed, and how they are formatted.

The release-begin command attempts to add a new open release to the changelog. The created release is open for modification such that subsequent uses of the change-add command will successfully add changes to the release. If the --version option is not used, a sensible version number will be generated based on the previous release (if any).

The release-finish command attempts to close the most recent open release present in the changelog, or a specific release if the --version option is specified. The target release is closed for modification such that subsequent uses of the change-add command targeting this release will fail.
The release-set-version command attempts to set the version number of the currently open release.
